Got 15 minutes? Grab a coffee and check out Xavier Debane's ninth Innovation Insider Podcast with special guests, Cindy Forbes and Dave Keirstead.

cc: Xavier Debane
:
Julie Fisher
In Manulife Canada
Check out Xavier Debane's lastest Innovation Insider Podcast this time with two guests, Cindy Forbes and Dave Keirstead. It's a goodie - well worth a listen!

Lucas Dunlop
–

19 hours ago

Translated
:
Lucas Dunlop
In Lego of Manulife
#MMSummer19 - First Week Winner

Good Afternoon!

I’m posting to announce the first weekly winner of the #mmsummer19 Contest. If you don’t know about the contest, please check out Shamus’ post here: https://www.yammer.com/manulife.com/threads/249357440679936

A big congratulations to Linda MacLean for her lovely Antigua Beach pics with her Mini-me’s! Her special pack of Mini-me accessories are on their way from our vendor as we speak.

Remember that you must post in the “Lego of Manulife” Yammer group and include the hashtag #mmsummer19 in your post to be considered eligible for the contest.

Let’s keep those awesome pics rolling in all the way up until August 30th!

- Lucas

1 9
View Full Conversation

Avtar Brar
–

23 hours ago

Hi Team,

 

Re: GITLab Reliability and Performance Update

 

Development teams have been encountering issues with GITLab reliability and performance over the past few weeks. We have been working closely with the ETS team to get the issue resolved ASAP.

 

The ETS team has made good progress in narrowing down the cause. The fix for the issue went in on Monday and should yield immediate results improving the reliability and performance of GITLab.

 

Thanks Greg Rowe, Matt Hogan, Ryan Fox, Louis Jacob , Mike Pettersen for taking this up at the highest priority and getting it resolved.

 

Please feel free to reach out to us or the ETS team, if you have questions or concerns.
Translated from English
cc: Greg Rowe, Matt Hogan, Ryan Fox, Louis Jacob, and Mike Pettersen

Hugh Cumming
–

July 26 at 5:07 PM

Announcement: Celebrating All-In Banking with a focus on the digital experience!

 

June marked the successful launch of our digital All-In Banking Package; a bundle of products where we re-imagined the customer journey to deliver a quick, simple and intuitive online experience that truly demonstrates what we mean when we say we’re transforming to be a digital, customer-centric leader.

 

Since becoming a digital leader also means embracing agile and delivering best-in-class technology, I’d like to share a bit about Technology as a key player in All-In Banking and offer some per...
Translated from English

Lucas Dunlop
–

July 26 at 3:33 PM –

Announcement: Employee Spotlight - GB Transformation Co-Op Squad

Hey All! Happy Friday!

 

 

Today we're celebrating a very special squad in our organization. The GB Transformation Co-Op Squad is...you guessed it...entirely made up of co-op students! Super Cool!

 

In their spotlight, the squad talks about all the fantastic work they've been doing. Spoiler Alert: They motivate each other to do better by...punching each other? Guess you'll have to read the spotlight to find out more!

 

 

Check out their spotlight here: https://mfc.sharepoint.com/sites/CNDTechCommunity/blog/Lists/Posts/Post.aspx?ID=261

 

 

 

Also, feel free to check out all of our other fabulous spotlights here: https://mfc.sharepoint.com/sites/CNDTechCommunity/blog/Lists/Categories/Category.aspx?CategoryId=6

 

 
Translated from English
cc: Emma Cobb, Luiz Costa, Sarah Ali, and Shivani Chidella

Terrence Chen
–

July 26 at 3:17 PM

Manulife University: Manulife Onboarding Portal (MOP)

 

Want to know how MOP can change how we onboard new hires in Manulife? If so, make sure to checkout Cohort 18's MOP demo today at 2:00 PM at 25 Water and on Skype.

 

If you would like to attend and have not yet received an invite for today's demo, please reach out to Hai Hua for an invite.
Translated from English
cc: Hai Hua

Greg Loker
–

July 26 at 12:06 PM

Announcement: Welcoming Jack Jones Head of Technology, Manulife Bank

After a long and thoughtful search for the ideal candidate, Rick Lunny, President and CEO of Manulife Bank, and I are happy to share that Jack Jones will be joining the organization as Head of Technology for Manulife Bank starting this Monday, July 29th.

Jack brings more than 14 years of leadership experience in the software technology space and joins us from D&H/Finastra where he was Senior Director, Product Development & Delivery. As part of this role, Jack led high-performing product developm...
Translated from English

David Farr
–

July 25 at 2:47 AM

Approving IBM Category 1-4 Request For Services (CAT 1-4 RFS) are #gross. The ServiceNow form to request one is fine. However, a totally separate RITM ticket is generated for financial approval. Technical teams think their stuff is approved, but when we ask IBM, they stay they're awaiting financiall approval. You have to carefully review the notes to find the name of the second ticket, open it, figure out who the financial approver is (they're randomly assigned), and then chase them.

 

The financial approver has little detail in the approval ticket because it's in the original request ticket. Can our ServiceNow gurus do better?
Translated from English

David Farr
–
